\begin{abstract}
We consider the ordering kinetics of a nonconserved scalar field advected by 
a uniform shear flow. Using the Ohta-Jasnow-Kawasaki approximation, 
modified to allow for shear-induced anisotropy, we calculate the asymptotic 
time dependence of the characteristic length scales, $L_\parallel$ and 
$L_\perp$, that describe the growth of order parallel and perpendicular to 
the mean domain orientation. In space dimension $d=3$ we find 
$L_\parallel \sim \gamma t^{3/2}$, $L_\perp \sim t^{1/2}$, where $\gamma$ 
is the shear rate, while for $d = 2$ we find
